Instruction: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and line two 9-inch cake pans with parchment paper, lightly coating them with cooking spray.
Heat the two together gently. Then, mix in the cocoa powder until smooth. Allow it to cool off.
Combine eggs and sour cream in a medium bowl using an electric mixer until well-combined, then mix in the stout mixture until incorporated.
Stir together and blend eggs and sour cream in a medium bowl using an electric mixer until thoroughly combined. Add the cooled stout mixture and mix until incorporated.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch cake pan.
Spread batter into prepared cast iron skillet. Bake until golden brown.
Allow the melted chocolate mixture to cool until it reaches a pourable consistency but is not excessively thin or runny, for about 10 to 15 minutes.
Gently stack one cake on top of the other, ensuring that the frosting sides are facing up. Drizzle the chocolate mixture over the top, allowing decorative drips to run down the sides.
